availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Son of George W. Barbour and Susan E. Barbour. Married to Mary Ann Hillman Barbour in Trigg County, Kentucky, on January 24, 1859. Father of Nannie Bell Barbour and Mary Barbour. Resident of Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 281A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 816-817.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, pp. 110-11.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Ferguson Precinct, p. 78B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335, p. 270.
"Dr Caldwell 'Kit' Barbour (1833-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial 123804401, accessed May 15, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/123804401.
